lines.line: Mumblelandlubbermumblemumble...
What right have ye to be so happy, landlubber?
Aye, that it is.
Will ye forgive an old sailor his temper? I'm in dire straits indeed.
I dunno, I need a pirate to help me with my problem, but none will sail with me.
Well, ye look like ye might have the right stuff, tell me would ye like te be a pirate?
It takes more grit than most have te be a pirate, and I don't think ye've got what it takes.
Well, I don't think ye could pirate yer way out of a chest full of piracy.
But since nobody else will risk the trip ye'll do!
I be Bill Teach, the Captain of the Adventurous, one of the finest ships ever to sail.
I'm in port doin' some legitimate tradin' before headin' back to Mos Le'Harmless.
It's a pirate stronghold off the southern coast of Morytania. Been in existence for years.
Of course ye do, once we make landfall ye'll have worked as a sailor on a pirate vessel.
Of course ye do! Plenty be claiming they've got what it takes to be a pirate.
This brings me back to the reason I'm stuck here of course, and the reason I need your help.
Last night I got into a war o' words with another Cap'n, and he has vowed to sink my ship.
By desertin'.
Every last one!
The second I leave port I'll come under attack. I think I'll be able te make it if I have another person helpin' out.
Ye said ye would help me out, will ye stand by yer word?
Arr! Ye struck me as a man of integrity!
My ship is the Adventurous, and she's at the east dock.
I'm sure I won't.
Well, that doesn't surprise me much.
On yer way, leave me be.
Aye, that it be. Come back when yer liver ain't so lily-like.
Let me finish my drink, landlubber!
If ye ain't up te scratch as a pirate I may not get another one.
Just remember, maybe ye'll get through it...
Ye came!
Well, I had the feelin' ye might have run off when ye realised how much of a task ye had ahead.
Aye, I should have remembered ye was eager.
Ye all ready to go?
Aye, take yer time, I'm not goin' anywhere without ye.
Ye all ready to go lad?
Ye don't say.
Well, without anyone else te help ye'll have te do some hard work if we don't want to end up on the sea bed.
Well if their first shot hadn't taken out the cannon I'd be firing that at them.
Arr! They seek te hole the ship! Go and take care of their cannon.
If ye grab some fuse from the gun locker, and a rope from the repair locker, then ye can use the rope on the sails.
Just take the fuse, use it on the barrel of gunpowder next to the cannon, and then light it with something.
A lantern, a tinderbox, it doesn't matter.
End of problem.
They have masts as well don't they?
Just do the same trick using some rope on their sails and swing over.
Stop doin' that!
Ye ain't a pirate yet by a long shot!
I'll be on deck if ye need me.
Well, ye'll need to silence their cannon before it sinks us. Before ye do that though, ye'll need to swing over.
Yer not much of a pirate are ye lad?
Ye climb up the mast and use a rope on the sails up there.
Then ye climb down and ye swing on the rope.
If I have te explain how ye do THAT then I might as well just send out some biscuit weevles.
Egad...
Well, ye'll need some fuse from the cannon locker below decks.
Swing over to the enemy ship and put the fuse in the barrel of gunpowder they'll have next to the cannon.
Then, use something on the fuse te get it lit. A tinderbox, candle or any sort of flame will do.
After that ye just step back and let it burn by its self.
Give me strength...
Go back?
Got a little scared now have we?
It's not that, I just need to grab something from the bank, that's all...
A likely story.
Are ye sure ye can't get by without it?
I thought as much.
Well, as much as this is an interestin' break, why don't ye head back to the ship?
Stop sayin' that!
All right, lad let's try this again. This time, try not te run away!
One look at the enemy and ye run away.
Get over there and take out their cannon before I throw ye there me self.
Kill the squid-lovin' dog!
I'll have ye guts fer garters!
Kill the landlubber!
Get off my ship!
Te Davy-Jones locker with ye!
Fancy a crumpet?
Sorry, I mean...
Arr! Run him through sez I!
I'm gonna kill ye!
Prepare te die!
Looks like they haven't been back to port to get that cannon fixed, which is lucky.
Get below and fix the holes in the hull pronto, or we'll sink before they have a chance te kill us!
Nailed shut and waterproofed?
Good work.
Why not pay them a visit and go plunder their hold?
Gadzooks...
Come back here and drop it in the chest in the hold.
I've been a pirate all me life and I've never heard anyone keep harpin' on like that!
Stop it!
I warn ye, if the first word out of yer mouth is 'Arr' I'll be wearing yer spleen as a novelty hat!
I should have seen that comin'
Let me see that.
Have what back?
Not yet! Let's give em a blast with the cannon before we leave!
Alright, try and stay with me on this one.
See, there is a secret technique for making things that be broken right again.
We call this magical process...repairin'.
Ye need to remove the old barrel, then replace it with a new one from the gun locker.
And then what?
I don't want to overload ye with too many details right now.
If ye know what is good for ye, yer off to fix the cannon!
By replacing the broken barrel with a new one! Hop to it, the salt air is clearly eatin' into yer brains!
Have ye sorted out the cannon yet?
Then hop to it lad!
Ye did? Great!
Now ye can give those pirates a good shot across their bows.
Ye'll need to load the cannon, and if ye get it wrong the barrel will blow.
First, ye take some powder from the powder keg.
Then ye use a ramrod from the gun locker on the powder to tamp the charge.
Then ye use a canister round on the cannon.
Finally ye use some fuse on the cannon, and light it like ye did the fuse on the barrel earlier.
Then, ye'll need to use the ramrod on the cannon to clean it out for the next shot.
Ye got all that?
And te think this was all I could get te help...
I can guess from the lack of an explosion that ye haven't fired the cannon yet, correct?
And I'll bet ye want a quick recap of how to do it, correct?
Ye got all that this time?
Yer still not a pirate, so cut that out!
We were on the home stretch lad why did we turn back?
Never mind, just go shoot the pirates and let's press on.
Aye?
Three! Three times! Three! One more than two, one less than four! Got it!
Were almost there! Just hole their hull and we'll be able to make it past. Get to it!
Ye've done it! They're sunk now!
Let's head to the island!
Bill? You look like you've been to Davey Jones' locker and back.
Oh, Miss La'Fiette, if only I were that lucky.
My crew deserted and I was stuck with an adventurer mannin' me ship.
He was as piratical as a bunch of Dwellberries...
Aye, I remember.
I'll leave you two alone.
All right...
Ok, yer now a pirate, but...
BUT ye can't just go around talking like some pirate in a fancy play.
No self-respectin' pirate says 'Arr' that much!
Well, except for Fancy Dan, but that be another story.
Here, have this book. It'll learn ye how to be a pirate.
Or at least learn ye te talk proper like one.
Aye...that be all ye need te do.
Ye'll need that book if ye want te trade with some of the pirates round here.
Outsiders tend not te understand them if ye catch me drift.
Anyway, I'd have been shark bait without ye.
If ye get a moment come see me fer yer share of the loot.
I'm sure as soon as ye stop yellin' 'Arr!' ye'll make a great pirate.
Thanks. If ye need a lift back, just come see me.
Sure ye can. Here.

characters.name: Bill Teach
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff seafaring British accent, weathered and exasperated tone. A seasoned pirate captain named after the infamous Blackbeard, commanding yet impatient with landlubbers. Speaks with heavy nautical slang and drops his g's.

characters.name: Mama
characters.description: Adult female, Caribbean-tinged pirate accent, warm but matter-of-fact tone. Runs a tavern on Mos Le'Harmless, worldly and observant with a dry sense of humor befitting a woman who has seen countless pirates come and go.

characters.name: Pirate
characters.description: Adult male, exaggerated theatrical pirate voice, aggressive and boisterous tone. A generic hostile pirate who shouts combat taunts with occasional oddly polite moments, prone to dramatic exclamations during battle.
